* Stian Soiland <ssoiland@...> [2007-06-25 14:00]:
> Before you have been "authenticated" any http requests to ANY
> address will redirect with 302 Found to the login page, while
> any other ports are firewalled.

That’s wrong. As Julian said, the proxy should return the login
page directly, in the body of a 4xx response. Probably 403.
(Julian proposed 5xx as an option but that would be wrong, IMO.)
The browser will render such a page just fine, as if nothing
unusual was going on; other programs, however, will know they’re
not dealing with a legitimate response.

Some such proxies are even worse – they send 301s. This is really
REALLY nasty if you accidentally launch your aggregator behind
such a proxy…
